node.title: Crypto has been deemed not halal in Indonesia. This is what it means for nearly 7 million investors
node.description: The religious council in Indonesia says cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin are forbidden. What does it mean for the millions of crypto enthusiasts across the country?

node.title: New COVID cases in Aboriginal communities near Katherine sends residents into 'hard' lockdown
node.description: A 78-year-old woman from Binjari community is been taken to hospital as nine new cases emerge in the community on the outskirts of Katherine.

node.title: Canberra engineer helps develop 'game-changer' propulsion system for satellites
node.description: For decades, space agencies have been searching for an alternative propulsion system to electrical ion engines powered by xenon gas, which is expensive, heavy and rare. Now, Canberra engineer Trevor Lafleur and his colleagues have the answer.

node.title: Get up to speed on all the COVID-19 updates from across Australia
node.description: Catch all the latest COVID-19 updates from across Australia, all in the one place.

node.title: Four people, believed to be children, unaccounted for in Melbourne house fire
node.description: Arson squad detectives are investigating the cause of the blaze in Werribee, which left three people in hospital and four more unaccounted for.

node.title: Victoria records four more COVID deaths and 1,275 new infections
node.description: There are 317 people in hospital with COVID-19, including 56 in intensive care and 25 of those receiving ventilation.

node.title: Missing China tennis player will reappear 'soon' - State media
node.description: Chinese tennis player Peng Shuai has been staying in her own home "freely" and will make a public appearance "soon", Global Times editor-in-chief Hu Xijin, a prominent state-media journalist, said on…

node.title: Missouri Detective Is Convicted in Fatal Shooting of Black Man Outside His Home
node.description: A judge convicted Detective Eric DeValkenaere of involuntary manslaughter in the death of Cameron Lamb outside his home in 2019.

node.title: Video Shows Atlanta Airport Travelers Ducking, Crawling on Floor After Surprise Gunfire
node.description: The airport said the weapon discharge was "accidental," and that there was no harm to passengers or employees after rumors circulated that there was an active shooter.

node.title: ‘Accidental Discharge’ of Firearm Prompts Panic at Atlanta Airport
node.description: Gunfire at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport on Saturday was accidental, officials said, but it led to flight disruptions and a stampede of passengers.

node.title: Jimmy Hoffa: Deathbed confession sparks long-missing US union boss body hunt
node.description: FBI agents have searched a plot of land in New Jersey after a deathbed confession renewed hope of solving union boss Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance 50 years ago.

node.title: Swimmers caught out by rips at northern beaches
node.description: Surf lifesavers in Auckland, Northland and Raglan are expecting another busy day on patrol after rescuing 46 people yesterday.

node.title: 'We Saved Kenosha': Trump Congratulates Self on 'Great' Rittenhouse Verdict
node.description: Trump said that if he hadn't sent federal agents into Kenosha during its 2020 unrest, the city would've "burned to the ground."

node.title: 9-Year-Old Girl Saves Mom From Attacker, Earns Police Award: 'She Hit Him Pretty Hard'
node.description: Video shows the assailant "was not expecting that and her actions were perfect timing," said a local police chief.

node.title: Wisconsin Newspaper Blasts Kyle Rittenhouse Not Guilty Verdict: He 'Is No Hero'
node.description: "The disappointing verdict is sure to embolden militant people who seek to take the law into their own hands," the Wisconsin State Journal's editorial board wrote.

node.title: Fourth Stimulus Check Update: Monthly $2K Petition 37,000 Signatures Away From 3 Million
node.description: The petition has drawn more than 2,962,640 signatures.

node.title: French women on the march in their thousands against violence, harassment and abuse
node.description: There is growing outrage in France over women killed by their husbands and boyfriends, with women increasingly speaking out against harassment and abuse.

node.title: ‘The most epic love story possible’: Hannah Kent’s new lesbian romance
node.description: The Burial Rites author has gone in a new direction in her latest novel, Devotion, which follows two girls across oceans and spiritual planes.

node.title: 'Preparing for the worst': Indigenous communities at risk of chronic illness epidemic
node.description: There are "serious concerns" for the many Aboriginal people living with chronic illnesses in regional NSW who did not keep up with their regular medical check-ups for fear of catching COVID-19.

node.title: Come on an underwater treasure hunt with Korea's haenyeo — the women of the sea
node.description: The volcanic island of Jeju is a wild paradise home to haenyeo, the women of the sea. Follow us as we join the free divers on a treasure hunt along its winding coast.

node.title: 'She danced around the wicket': How Betty Wilson blazed a trail for our cricket stars
node.description: Dubbed “the female Bradman”, Betty Wilson was Australia’s greatest all-round cricketer. In Melbourne today, cricket fans celebrate the 100th anniversary of her birth.

node.title: Identified flying objects over North Queensland sign of space race gone 'bonkers', says expert
node.description: Lights in the night sky have startled some sky watchers this week, but to a University of Queensland academic they're undesirable, not unidentified, flying objects.

node.title: 'I don't want to cause any more problems': Why Queenslanders are choosing to get their COVID jab now
node.description: Queensland administers nearly half of Australia's first doses of the COVID-19 vaccine in the last week with many only rolling their sleeves up now. So what's behind the uptick?

node.title: National Park Service gets first Native American director
node.description: Sams, a member of the Confederated Tribes of the Umatilla Indian Reservation, will head the agency.

node.title: Macy’s Used to Set the Balloons Free, and Other Thanksgiving Day Parade Facts
node.description: Here is a closer look at the milestones and mishaps involving the helium-filled characters that populate the holiday parade.

node.title: Family 'in Shock' After Man Accused of Impregnating, Running Over 13-Year-Old Girl
node.description: The girl's mother told WRAL that she had been in a relationship with the man for four years prior to the incident, but was not aware that her daughter was being abused.

node.title: My Food Bag savours $9.4m half year profit
node.description: The food delivery company My Food Bag has made a record half year profit, despite the volume of sales dropping.

node.title: 'Don't get caught napping' - pillow fighting enters combat sports arena
node.description: Pillow fighting is moving out of the bedroom and into the boxing ring, with a new event premiering in Florida next year.

node.title: Covid-19: Eight marae form collective aimed at boosting vaccination rates
node.description: A collective of marae around the Kāwhia harbour are banding together to encourage whānau in their community to get vaccinated.

node.title: New Plymouth's fatbergs: Residents urged to just flush the three Ps
node.description: A fatberg which caused a sewage overflow in New Plymouth recently has highlighted problems caused by residents pouring cooking fat down the kitchen sink.
